subject: Ethics
title: History of Informed Consent
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: History of Informed Consent.

hook.text: In 1846, a dentist pulled a man's tooth using ether anesthesiaâ€”without explaining the experimental gas.

buildup.text: For centuries, doctors performed procedures without explaining risks. 'Trust me, I'm a doctor' was enough.

discovery.text: The 1957 Salgo case first used the term 'informed consent,' ruling patients must know risks before treatment.

twist.text: Even today, consent forms are often pages of legal jargon that patients sign without truly understanding.

climax.text: Real informed consent isn't a signatureâ€”it's a conversation where the patient genuinely understands the choice.

punchline.text: A signature isn't consent. Understanding is.

quiz.question: What landmark case first established the term 'informed consent'?
